intro: Urera commersoniana, commonly known as the Commerson's urera, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. Urera commersoniana is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
